lines: We all knew it would happen sooner or later... everyone except you, apparently, bartender.
Too many bottles, too little time, and the inspector finally got the better of you.
Try again, you'll be luckier (or at least quicker).
The debts were mounting and unfortunately your savings were no use.
Running a bar with such high prices is an arduous task, you knew that from the start, but you tried anyway.
After all, capitalism and prohibitionism don't mix very well when it comes to running an undercover bar.
Like every morning you go to open your bar, you find people crowded in front of the entrance, you see and smell smoke.
Your bar has gone up in flames, dreams and hopes have gone up in smoke from night to morning.
Actually, you should really invest in an ashtray
In the end, a law was changed for the city of Korgis, unlike everyone else, you know who it was, the Bartenders' Union never gave up on you, and you managed to fight to the end.
Now you are free to continue your work, not that you ever stopped.
